info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Alexander, southeastern Caldwell and east central Burke Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 225 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Lenoir, or over Sawmills. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lenoir, Sawmills, Granite Falls, Valdese, Hudson, Icard, Cajah`s Mountain, Hildebran, Connelly Springs and Rutherford College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
